Package infodynamics.measures.mixed.gaussian

Class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteGaussian

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.mixed.gaussian.MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteGaussian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete, java.lang.Cloneable
    public class MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteGaussian
extends java.lang.Object
implements MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete, java.lang.Cloneable

    Computes the differential mutual information between a given multivariate set of observations (assuming that the probability distribution function for these observations is a multivariate Gaussian distribution) and a discrete variable.

    This is done by examining the conditional probability distribution for the multivariate continuous variable C (given the discrete variable D) against the probability distribution for C: MI(C;D) := H(C) - H(C|D).

    CAVEAT EMPTOR: The real question this type of calculation asks is to what extent does knowing the value of the discrete variable reduce variance in the continuous variable(s). Indeed, it does not seem to behave as we would normally expect a mutual information calculation: if we add more continuous variables in, it increases in spite of redundancy between these variables. TODO Further exploration should take place here ...

    These calculators are EXPERIMENTAL -- not properly tested, and not well documented. The intended calling pattern is similar to ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

    Usage:

    1. Construct MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteGaussian()
    2. initialise(int, int)
    3. Set properties using setProperty(String, String)
    4. Provide the observations to the calculator using: setObservations(double[][], int[]), or #setCovariances(double[][], double[][]).
    5. Compute the required information-theoretic results, primarily: computeAverageLocalOfObservations() to return the average differential entropy based on either the set variance or the variance of the supplied observations; or other calls to compute local values or statistical significance.

    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    entropy for Gaussian random variables defined at }

        public void setObservations​(double[][] continuousObservations,

        Set the properties from which the mutual information should be computed.
        Specified by:
        setObservations in interface MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete
        Parameters:
        continuousObservations - observations of the joint continuous variables; first index is time or observation number, second index is variable number (the number of variables should be equal to the number of dimensions set in MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete.initialise(int, int).)
        discreteObservations - observations of the discrete variable; must be the same number of observations as supplied for continuousObservations. Each observation must lie in the range 0..base-1, where base was set by MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete.initialise(int, int).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations​(double[][] contStates,
                                                      int[] discreteStates)
                                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the local mutual information for each pair of continuous and discrete values supplied here, using probability distribution functions generated using the observations previously supplied to the method setObservations(double[][], int[]).
        Specified by:
        computeLocalUsingPreviousObservations in interface MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete
        Parameters:
        contStates - observations of the joint continuous variables, as specified in setObservations(double[][], int[])
        discreteStates - observations of the discrete variable, as specified in setObservations(double[][], int[])
        Returns:
        a time series of the local mutual information values for each supplied observation, in nats (NOT bits)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance​(int numPermutationsToCheck)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete

        Compute the empiricial statistical significance of the mutual information of the previously supplied observations via MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete.setObservations(double[][], int[]). We destroy the p(x,y) correlations, while retaining the p(x), p(y) marginals, to check how significant this mutual information actually was. Specifically, this method returns an EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution object containing numPermutationsToCheck surrogate measurements where the discrete data is shuffled against the continuous data set.

        This is in the spirit of Chavez et. al. which was performed for Transfer entropy.

        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete
        Parameters:
        numPermutationsToCheck - the number of permuted surrogates to examine
        Returns:
        the proportion of MI scores from the distribution which have higher or equal MIs to ours.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        "Chavez et. al., 'Statistical assessment of nonlinear causality: application to epileptic EEG signals', Journal of Neuroscience Methods 124 (2003) 113-128"

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance​(int[][] newOrderings)
                                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete

        Compute the empiricial statistical significance of the mutual information of the previously supplied observations via MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete.setObservations(double[][], int[]). This method performs as per MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete.computeSignificance(int) except that the shuffling of the discrete time series is specified here by the newOrderings parameter.

        Specified by:
        computeSignificance in interface MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete
        Parameters:
        newOrderings - the specific new orderings to use. First index is for the new ordering number; second index is, for that particular reordering, which time point of the original series to grab at that point.
        Returns:
        the proportion of MI scores from the distribution which have higher or equal MIs to ours.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        MutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscrete.computeSignificance(int)
